getStorageAt(uint256,uint256).details: Reads `length` bytes of storage in the currents contract

params.length: - the number of words (32 bytes) of data to read
params.offset: - the offset in the current contract's storage in words to start reading from

simulateAndRevert(address,bytes).details: Performs a delegetecall on a targetContract in the context of self. Internally reverts execution to avoid side effects (making it static). This method reverts with data equal to `abi.encode(bool(success), bytes(response))`. Specifically, the `returndata` after a call to this method will be: `success:bool || response.length:uint256 || response:bytes`.

params.calldataPayload: Calldata that should be sent to the target contract (encoded method name and arguments).
params.targetContract: Address of the contract containing the code to execute.

documentation.text:
@title StorageAccessible - generic base contract that allows callers to access all internal storage.
 @notice See https://github.com/gnosis/util-contracts/blob/bb5fe5fb5df6d8400998094fb1b32a178a47c3a1/contracts/StorageAccessible.sol
